intro: [WRONG START] Embellia variabilis var. nigropunctata, commonly known as black-punctured embelia, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with dark spots. The plant produces tiny, clustered white flowers followed by small, woody fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both traditional medicine and ecological studies.
